page.title: 07Nantwich-Points of Interest.
page.content: The Parish Church of St.Mary is the oldest in the town.It has an octagonal tower which is still the tallest of Nantwich's buildings.Inside the carved wooden stalls contrast with the bright modern tapestry{.Churche's Mansion}was not damaged by the fire of 1583.It is now a restaurant and is a fine example of a 16th century merchant's home.{The {Crown Hotel}is a three-storeyed black and white building which was rebuilt after the fire at a cost of Â£300. Our swimming baths has two pools. The outside one stands on the site of a spring which provided the Romans with their{salt.}Adjoining it is a new indoor pool.The area is now called Snow Hill. As well as many interesting sites Nantwich has good parks for sport and recreation.There is also a river walk from which the town can be seen.
